meanings.definition: A temporary reduction in electrical power supply.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, the brownouts caused the lights to flicker.
meanings.sent2: The city experienced brownouts due to the power grid overload.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected brownouts turned the office into a dimly lit maze.
meanings.sent4: In the middle of the concert, the brownouts created a suspenseful atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The brownouts during the heatwave made everyone appreciate electricity more.

meanings.definition: A dimming or reduction in brightness of lights.
meanings.sent1: The brownouts in the theater added a mysterious ambiance to the play.
meanings.sent2: The street was barely visible during the brownouts in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The brownouts made the room feel cozy and intimate.
meanings.sent4: The brownouts cast eerie shadows on the walls of the old house.
meanings.sent5: The sudden brownouts turned the bustling city into a quiet, shadowy place.

meanings.definition: A period of decreased mental alertness or cognitive function.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, the brownouts in his brain made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent2: The lack of sleep caused brownouts in her ability to remember things.
meanings.sent3: His brain felt like it was experiencing brownouts during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent4: The stress of the exam led to mental brownouts and confusion.
meanings.sent5: The brownouts in his thinking cleared up after a good night's rest.
